Test Case Name: Verify manuscript numbering on List of Endorsements
Description: Verify that manuscripts are correctly numbered on the List of Endorsements
Step Description: 1. Open Liability form 2. Navigate to List of Endorsements section 3. Verify manuscript numbering
Expected Result: All manuscripts should be sequentially numbered starting from 1

Test Case Name: Verify numbering sequence is sequential
Description: Verify that manuscript numbering follows sequential order without gaps
Step Description: 1. Add multiple manuscripts to endorsements 2. Check numbering sequence
User Story Number: etc.) with no gaps or duplicates

Test Case Name: Verify numbering persists after save
Description: Verify that manuscript numbering remains consistent after saving the form
Step Description: 1. Add numbered manuscripts 2. Save form 3. Reload form 4. Check numbering
Expected Result: Numbering should persist and remain unchanged after form save and reload

Test Case Name: Verify numbering in exported endorsement list
Description: Verify that manuscript numbering appears correctly in exported/printed endorsement list
Step Description: 1. Create numbered endorsements 2. Export list to PDF 3. Verify numbering in output
Expected Result: Manuscript numbering should be visible and correct in exported formats

Test Case Name: Verify numbered manuscripts cannot be reordered
Description: Verify that manually reordering manuscripts maintains correct numbering
Step Description: 1. Add numbered manuscripts 2. Attempt to reorder items 3. Check numbering
Expected Result: System should either prevent reordering or auto-renumber if reordered

Test Case Name: Verify deletion updates numbering
Description: Verify that deleting a manuscript updates the numbering of remaining items
Step Description: 1. Add 5 numbered manuscripts 2. Delete manuscript #3 3. Check remaining numbering
Expected Result: Remaining manuscripts should be renumbered sequentially after deletion

Test Case Name: Verify duplicate numbering is prevented
Description: Verify that the system prevents manually assigning duplicate manuscript numbers
Step Description: 1. Attempt to create two manuscripts with same number 2. Try to save
Expected Result: System should prevent duplicate numbering or show validation error

Test Case Name: Validate numbering with empty manuscript list
Description: Verify system behavior when List of Endorsements is empty
Step Description: 1. Open empty endorsement list 2. Check for numbering
Expected Result: Empty list should display with no numbering or placeholder

Test Case Name: Validate numbering with large manuscript count
Description: Verify manuscript numbering works correctly with large number of items (100+)
Expected Result: All manuscripts should be numbered correctly up to the maximum count

Test Case Name: Validate numbering format consistency
Description: Verify that all manuscript numbers follow consistent formatting (e.g.
Test Repository path: 1. Add manuscripts and check number format 2. Verify consistency
Status: Manuscript numbers should follow consistent format throughout the list

Test Case Name: Validate numbering with special characters in manuscript names
Description: Verify numbering works when manuscript names contain special characters
Step Description: 1. Add manuscript with special characters in name 2. Check numbering
Expected Result: Numbering should work correctly regardless of manuscript name content

Test Case Name: Validate numbering with very long manuscript names
Description: Verify numbering works with very long manuscript names (255+ characters)
Step Description: 1. Add manuscript with long name (255+ chars) 2. Check numbering
Expected Result: Numbering should display correctly even with long names

Test Case Name: Validate numbering after bulk import
Description: Verify that imported manuscripts are correctly numbered
Step Description: 1. Import bulk manuscripts 2. Check numbering of imported items
Expected Result: All imported manuscripts should be sequentially numbered

Test Case Name: Validate numbering with Unicode characters in names
Description: Verify numbering works when manuscript names contain Unicode characters
Status: Numbering should work correctly with Unicode manuscript names

Test Case Name: Verify numbering updates on manuscript addition
Description: Verify that numbering updates correctly when new manuscripts are added to existing list
Step Description: 1. Create initial numbered list 2. Add new manuscript 3. Verify new number assigned
Expected Result: New manuscript should receive the next sequential number

Test Case Name: Validate numbering field accepts numeric input only
Description: Verify that manuscript number field only accepts numeric values
Step Description: 1. Attempt to enter non-numeric value in number field 2. Save
Expected Result: System should reject non-numeric input or convert to numeric

Test Case Name: Validate numbering with negative numbers
Description: Verify that negative numbers are not allowed for manuscript numbering
Step Description: 1. Attempt to assign negative number 2. Try to save
Expected Result: System should reject negative numbers and show validation error

Test Case Name: Validate numbering with decimal values
Description: Verify that decimal values are not accepted for manuscript numbering
Step Description: 1. Attempt to enter decimal number (1.5) 2. Try to save
Expected Result: System should reject decimal values and show validation error

Test Case Name: Verify numbering in multi-page endorsement list
Description: Verify that manuscript numbering continues correctly across multiple pages
Step Description: 1. Create large endorsement list spanning multiple pages 2. Check numbering
Expected Result: Numbering should be sequential across all pages

Test Case Name: Validate numbering with null/empty manuscript records
Description: Verify system behavior when manuscript records have null or empty values
Step Description: 1. Create manuscript with empty name or fields 2. Check numbering
Expected Result: System should handle null/empty values gracefully and still number correctly
